Within the COO Risk Finance (COORF), a Data Quality Circle has been established to ensure that ING Bank has trustable data which is fully fit for the purpose (timely, complete, accurate, adoptable, comprehensive, consistent and appropriate), facilitated by a state-of-the-art data architecture and IT infrastructure. As part of this function, Data Analyst role(s) have been established with the responsibility to collect, analyses data and issues as well as present insightful findings for non-financial risk function. As a Data Analyst you are not afraid of handling and analyzing highly complex data. You are great at converting this data into relevant dashboards, reports and insights. By presenting these findings effectively you support stakeholders in important decision-making. As you will be operating in a complex stakeholder environment it??s important you can prioritize information and insight needs. You are an energetic, motivating person who can work as part of a multidisciplinary team and who can also work independently, think and act out of the box and take accountability. And you contribute to the ING One Agile Way of Working and safeguard the Orange Code. If you are good at: Understanding banking regulations and data quality functional requirements in order to define and create data quality reports for identified critical data elements in coordination with data owners, data stewards and operational teams Analysing complex Data issues that go beyond squad and/or tribe boundaries, with a view to designing complete solutions. Collecting relevant data, analyzing and reporting. You clean up and process raw data, correlate different types of data and can recognize patterns. Interpreting data, analyse results and deliver excellently substantiated data analyses using standard techniques and tools, which lead to improved business decisions or better data quality. Supporting tribes and squads in their decision-making by describing and visualizing discovered insights and predictions and advise your business partners on data and insight analysis, commercial opportunities and market developments. If you are: A professional displaying the following behaviours and background: You have a college degree in e.g. Mathematics, Informatics, Econometrics, Computer/Data Science, Information Management or Statistics Attention to Detail: Data is precise. You make sure you are vigilant in your analysis to come to correct conclusions You are a strong communicator and can present your analyses in a clear manner Excellent English written and verbal communication skills You have knowledge of and experience in Data Analysis in the financial services industry Expert with strong analytical skills, using state-of-the-art methods and techniques Experienced in relevant tooling such as PowerBI, Tableau, R, SQL, Python If you can: Convincingly put forward your proposals and are a real team player in reaching broad agreement on the road to follow. In this way, you can contribute to delivering standardized, uniform and fully adapted solutions to complex business issues and processes. WHO WE ARE  We are Power Factors, developer of the world??s leading cloud platform for renewable energy companies. Our SaaS platform, Drive, is used to manage over 25 Gigawatts of renewable energy across the planet (enough to power approximately 1.5 million homes). We??re tackling one of the world??s most important challenges in making renewable energy the world??s leading source of power by driving down the cost to operate wind and solar power plants. Our company is going through accelerated growth fueled by the unprecedented transition to clean, renewable energy.  The Drive platform continues to extend throughout the renewable energy market. Our platform collects millions of IoT and other data points, cleanses the data, detects occurring issues, identifies leading indicators to predict future issues, and adds a full advanced analytic capability on top of this rich, high-value dataset. In addition to issue detection and analytics, Drive adds the toolsets needs to take analytic insights to action such as case management and work order management.  To our customers, we deliver excellent customer service and a high-value system of engagement that provides the results they are looking for: lower operations costs and higher output from their renewable energy power plants. We are an agile development company, big enough to make an impact, but small enough to move quickly to execute in a growing industry and take advantage of rapidly evolving technology. To our employees, we provide a culture that values respect, teamwork, transparency, and achievement.  THE ROLE  Power Factors is seeking a qualified candidate to join our Company in the role of Data Analyst, Customer Success. In this role, you will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of tools that aims at automating tasks and optimize processes and increase efficiency. More precisely, you will write scripts and develop helper applications to automate repetitive tasks. You will work on identifying new process improvement opportunities, tracking the most important metrics to diagnose problems, develop and tool filter and categorize issues and prioritize cases . Ultimately, you will ensure the workflows, reports, and tools implemented are constantly improving the level of service of the Customer Success Department.  In this role, you will report to the Helpdesk Manager based in Carmona Cavite, Philippines. Although this position is based out of our office located in Silang Cavite, you will be allowed to work remotely from home in the Philippines during the application of our COVID19 confinement period that is currently in force.  IMPORTANT NOTE: Power Factors is applying COVID-19 preventive measures to safeguard the health and safety of our employees, customers, business partners, and communities where we have offices. Please note that the selected candidate will be working from home for the duration of said applicable measures.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Design, develop, and implement tools and applications for the Customer Success Helpdesk team to automate repetitive tasks; Independently take a project from idea to functional application; Work in partnership with Helpdesk teams to gather, process, and interpret Case information and workflows to formulate Business Impact Analysis; Support with broader ticket analysis. report writing and presenting findings and propose workflow solutions; Translate business requirements into well-designed solution tools that best leverage our platform; Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques; Work with management to prioritize business and information needs. Identify, propose, and actively participate in process improvement and other projects as required. REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor??s in software engineering or college technical degree in a related field; Minimum of 5 years of significant experience working as a Data Analyst / Data scientist / Business Data Analyst in a software company: Strong knowledge of analytics tools and processes; Strong understanding of reporting packages/spreadsheet tools (Microsoft Power BI), databases (querying and scripting in SQL. etc), programming (Python, PowerShell, JavaScript or related languages); Good working knowledge with OSISoft??s PI system, SQL, Salesforce, and Microsoft Power BI is beneficial; Familiar with cloud-based technologies Azure, AWS, & Rackspace; ITIL / Lean-Six Sigma certification is considered an asset.  KEY COMPETENCIES  Accountability Agility Effective Communication Critical Thinking Problem Analysis Process Development Project Management Decision Making/ Judgement  EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER  Power Factors is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Description The Opportunity ?? Turn data into insights  The Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for helping Gen unleash the potential of its marketing data. Their role is to own, manage and analyze Gen??s marketing data to create valuable insights that can be used to optimize performance.   The Marketing Data Analyst will support the ongoing transformation of the marketing function and our drive for predictable multi-channel lead generation. Central to the success of this role is a deep understanding of marketing analytics and the ability to advise and guide other members of the marketing domain on the best course of action to optimize performance.   Core responsibilities include: Developing insights for continuous improvement: Analyze and interpret data using a range of analysis and presentation tools and make recommendations for actions to optimize marketing performance. Measurement: Development of relevant metrics and KPIs to determine ongoing performance of marketing and lead generation activities. Reporting: Creation of marketing dashboards and reporting framework and ownership of ongoing reporting activities to monitor marketing performance. Data stewardship: Ownership of all marketing and CRM data ensuring good data management practices and compliance with GDPR and other regional legislation. Collaboration: Collaborate closely with colleagues in the marketing and sales domains and the multidisciplinary teams within Gen to ensure marketing insights are used to drive continuous improvement across the buyer journey.  Key Deliverables Analysis and interpretation of marketing data from multiple sources to create insights that optimize marketing performance ?? with the primary objective of optimizing lead generation activities and increasing the number of Marketing Qualified Leads. Help Gen improve its understanding of how customers and prospects interact with the business via multiple channels to optimize buyer journeys. Create a real-time dashboard and regular reporting system that helps the marketing domain and other internal stakeholders better understand prospect and customer paths to purchase. Be the custodian of Gen??s marketing data. Drive excellent data management practices to ensure data quality and that Gen??s data complies with all relevant regional guidelines and legislations. Qualifications Key Relationships, Collaborations and Connections  This role reports to the Digital Marketing Manager and will be a key member of the growing marketing team. They will also be expected to build close relationships with colleagues from the Gen Sales and CX domains. They will also collaborate closely with digital marketing colleagues in Arcadis core  What We Are Looking For  The ideal candidate will have a passion for data and insights. We??re looking for someone highly analytical - but a head for numbers isn??t quite enough. The successful candidate will also be able to see the people behind the data ?? and have a knack for using data to understand human behaviors and drive continuous improvement. It would be highly advantageous if their experience has been gained in a fast moving SaaS business ?? where the focus is on driving a healthy and predictable lead generation engine.  They will have a proven track record in analyzing, visualizing and reporting on data to create highly valuable insights and will need to feel comfortable advising others in the organization on where changes are needed based on their findings.  Beyond that we are looking for someone who possesses: A talent for visualizing data and communicating findings in an easy-to-understand way A commercial mindset to drive value from insights A brilliant combination of analytical skills and customer insights to really ??get under the skin?? of what the data is saying to understand paths to purchase In-depth understanding of relevant analytical, reporting, visualization and presentation tools to allow clear communication of findings and recommendations A thirst for learning ?? constantly keeping updated on new trends, software and processes to enhance Gen??s digital marketing approach. Experience using Hubspot CRM would be highly advantageous

Company Description About Dalstrong Inc:  We are a large international kitchen knife and cookware e-commerce company based in Canada but with a team that is distributed around the world. We sell through many channels including amazon, Shopify & Walmart. You can find out more about the company here https://dalstrong.com/  Job Description The role:  You will help fill the gaps assisting with various tasks throughout the organization. Some aspects of the job will leverage your creative and technical talents by streamlining our processes through technology and/or enhancing our work products visual appeal and consistency with the overall company brand. Other aspects of the role will include data entry tasks such as, processing bills, recording inventory movements, etc. You should be comfortable handling mundane work as well as ad-hoc creative or technical projects. You will be reporting to the accounting manager on the finance team so experience in accounting is a plus but can be easily learned on the job. No work experience required but testing will be provided to measure aptitude.  About the Finance Team:  You will get the opportunity to work directly with the Accounting manager, who is a Canadian CPA. The entire team is overseen by the CFO who is a 15 years experienced CMA. This will be an incredible career development and learning opportunity with endless opportunity for growth and advancement if you are up to the challenge as the company is projected to grow 30% year over year. Build expertise in an ever growing in demand industry while being coached by highly trained individuals.  Qualifications Work/life balance:  Enjoy being a truly valued member of a high-performing team. We target for our Philippines team members to work 40 hours per week. There will be occasional spikes in work where more work required but we strive to make those as rare as possible.  Helpful Skills:  NetSuite (This is a major plus if you have it) Amazon Accounting Shopify Accounting Paypal Accounting Excel VBA Programming or other programming skills. A solid home office set up (If you have dual monitors this is a major plus) Cost accounting experience  Must haves: Graphic Design (Beautiful financial reports & working papers encourage confidence in the underlying data) Willingness to work for a single employer exclusively Capacity to work additional hours if needed Exceptional attention to detail  You must be inventive and proactive in designing and developing new ways of working to continually streamline the department improving upon the processes and suggesting new ideas on a regular basis.  How to apply  Copy paste general applications will be ignored. I need you to go through all of the "must haves" and "helpful skills" and highlight to me exactly why you are the absolute best fit for these requirements and send a video pitch explaining why you are the perfect fit for the job with a quick tour of your home office. A copy of your resume and an example of some of your work if available would also be helpful  Additional Information What??s Included? Full-time USD compensation Flexible work-life-balance and a fun remote culture with a booming eCom team!

Description The Opportunity ?? Turn data into insights  The Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for helping Gen unleash the potential of its marketing data. Their role is to own, manage and analyze Gen??s marketing data to create valuable insights that can be used to optimize performance.   The Marketing Data Analyst will support the ongoing transformation of the marketing function and our drive for predictable multi-channel lead generation. Central to the success of this role is a deep understanding of marketing analytics and the ability to advise and guide other members of the marketing domain on the best course of action to optimize performance.   Core responsibilities include: Developing insights for continuous improvement: Analyze and interpret data using a range of analysis and presentation tools and make recommendations for actions to optimize marketing performance. Measurement: Development of relevant metrics and KPIs to determine ongoing performance of marketing and lead generation activities. Reporting: Creation of marketing dashboards and reporting framework and ownership of ongoing reporting activities to monitor marketing performance. Data stewardship: Ownership of all marketing and CRM data ensuring good data management practices and compliance with GDPR and other regional legislation. Collaboration: Collaborate closely with colleagues in the marketing and sales domains and the multidisciplinary teams within Gen to ensure marketing insights are used to drive continuous improvement across the buyer journey.  Key Deliverables Analysis and interpretation of marketing data from multiple sources to create insights that optimize marketing performance ?? with the primary objective of optimizing lead generation activities and increasing the number of Marketing Qualified Leads. Help Gen improve its understanding of how customers and prospects interact with the business via multiple channels to optimize buyer journeys. Create a real-time dashboard and regular reporting system that helps the marketing domain and other internal stakeholders better understand prospect and customer paths to purchase. Be the custodian of Gen??s marketing data. Drive excellent data management practices to ensure data quality and that Gen??s data complies with all relevant regional guidelines and legislations. Qualifications Key Relationships, Collaborations and Connections  This role reports to the Digital Marketing Manager and will be a key member of the growing marketing team. They will also be expected to build close relationships with colleagues from the Gen Sales and CX domains. They will also collaborate closely with digital marketing colleagues in Arcadis core  What We Are Looking For  The ideal candidate will have a passion for data and insights. We??re looking for someone highly analytical - but a head for numbers isn??t quite enough. The successful candidate will also be able to see the people behind the data ?? and have a knack for using data to understand human behaviors and drive continuous improvement. It would be highly advantageous if their experience has been gained in a fast moving SaaS business ?? where the focus is on driving a healthy and predictable lead generation engine.  They will have a proven track record in analyzing, visualizing and reporting on data to create highly valuable insights and will need to feel comfortable advising others in the organization on where changes are needed based on their findings.  Beyond that we are looking for someone who possesses: A talent for visualizing data and communicating findings in an easy-to-understand way A commercial mindset to drive value from insights A brilliant combination of analytical skills and customer insights to really ??get under the skin?? of what the data is saying to understand paths to purchase In-depth understanding of relevant analytical, reporting, visualization and presentation tools to allow clear communication of findings and recommendations A thirst for learning ?? constantly keeping updated on new trends, software and processes to enhance Gen??s digital marketing approach. Experience using Hubspot CRM would be highly advantageous

Company Description About Dalstrong Inc:  We are a large international kitchen knife and cookware e-commerce company based in Canada but with a team that is distributed around the world. We sell through many channels including amazon, Shopify & Walmart. You can find out more about the company here https://dalstrong.com/  Job Description The role:  You will help fill the gaps assisting with various tasks throughout the organization. Some aspects of the job will leverage your creative and technical talents by streamlining our processes through technology and/or enhancing our work products visual appeal and consistency with the overall company brand. Other aspects of the role will include data entry tasks such as, processing bills, recording inventory movements, etc. You should be comfortable handling mundane work as well as ad-hoc creative or technical projects. You will be reporting to the accounting manager on the finance team so experience in accounting is a plus but can be easily learned on the job. No work experience required but testing will be provided to measure aptitude.  About the Finance Team:  You will get the opportunity to work directly with the Accounting manager, who is a Canadian CPA. The entire team is overseen by the CFO who is a 15 years experienced CMA. This will be an incredible career development and learning opportunity with endless opportunity for growth and advancement if you are up to the challenge as the company is projected to grow 30% year over year. Build expertise in an ever growing in demand industry while being coached by highly trained individuals.  Qualifications Work/life balance:  Enjoy being a truly valued member of a high-performing team. We target for our Philippines team members to work 40 hours per week. There will be occasional spikes in work where more work required but we strive to make those as rare as possible.  Helpful Skills:  NetSuite (This is a major plus if you have it) Amazon Accounting Shopify Accounting Paypal Accounting Excel VBA Programming or other programming skills. A solid home office set up (If you have dual monitors this is a major plus) Cost accounting experience  Must haves: Graphic Design (Beautiful financial reports & working papers encourage confidence in the underlying data) Willingness to work for a single employer exclusively Capacity to work additional hours if needed Exceptional attention to detail  You must be inventive and proactive in designing and developing new ways of working to continually streamline the department improving upon the processes and suggesting new ideas on a regular basis.  How to apply  Copy paste general applications will be ignored. I need you to go through all of the "must haves" and "helpful skills" and highlight to me exactly why you are the absolute best fit for these requirements and send a video pitch explaining why you are the perfect fit for the job with a quick tour of your home office. A copy of your resume and an example of some of your work if available would also be helpful  Additional Information What??s Included? Full-time USD compensation Flexible work-life-balance and a fun remote culture with a booming eCom team!

Rakuten is Japan's leading Internet services company, a largest e-commerce company in Japan, and the third largest e-commerce marketplace worldwide with a combined membership of almost 1.3 billion. Company Overview: Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, a leading provider of credit market data, analytical tools and risk services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst. Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide help investors to make important credit judgments with confidence. As a global credit rating agency, Fitch Ratings gauges the ability of entities and instruments to meet their credit obligations. Investors and financial market participants rely on multiple sources, and the credit rating ?? indicating how an issue or transaction is likely to perform over time ?? is one of their key inputs. In this way, we help investors map potential credit risks. Fitch Solutions, a subsidiary of Fitch Ratings, provides a range of industry-leading products and professional development services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, it distributes the ratings, research and financial data of Fitch Ratings through a variety of flexible platforms. With innovation and experience behind every solution it brings to market, our offerings are designed to meet the diverse needs of the fixed-income markets. Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws. Fitch Solutions also encourages external training by subsidising external courses, such as the CFA and relevant language classes. Areas of focus include: Data analysis and forecasting Analysis surrounding the consumer facing sectors, retail and food and drink segments Industry trend analysis Opportunity and risk assessment Assessing the impact of macro, political and other sector developments on the industry Government regulation Company Analysis Qualifications & Skills: We are looking for candidates with a strong academic background and a passion for the subject matter, with prior understanding of basic macroeconomic principles and a familiarity with world affairs. Position Summary: We are looking for a seasoned analytics professional to work in our Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Data & Analytics group, focused on designing and deploying dashboards, ad-hoc reports and other visualization tools to provide business insights for our regional Commercial teams. The ideal candidate will have a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for our commercial operations. This position will work closely with leaders across sales, services, operations and marketing to support and implement high-quality, data-driven decisions. They will use a combination of analytical and visualization techniques and potentially advanced data modeling and predictive modeling techniques where necessary to interpret key findings and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes. They will take requirements for analysis or reporting and ensure optimal data capture, insights attainment, and reporting capabilities are available, escalating regional needs to global teams where necessary. They will be an expert in defining and deploying these key metrics, reports, and dashboards to provide a 360 view of performance across key internal and customer processes, collaborating with global teams to identify knowledge gaps and developing plans to ascertain critical insights to progress our commercial strategy where necessary. This position will report directly to the Associate Director, Data & Analytics - APJ and can be based in Singapore or Australia.  Tasks & Responsibilities: Create interactive stories, dashboards, and visualizations leveraging Tableau. Develop data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support key business decisions. Build the required data extracts required for solutions, extracting from multiple sources where necessary. Analyse data from multiple angles, looking for trends that highlight areas of concerns or opportunities. Capture user requirements for standard reports. Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business need and requirements. Define user requirements and work with users to execute projects to meet requirements. Create and maintain user personas, use-cases, and business requirements documents. Generate ad-hoc reports for field sales, customer care or service managers and assist in the data mining process upon request. Empower end-users to ask their own questions of company/industry data through development and deployment of self-service reporting. Deliver transformative solutions that are aligned to industry best practices and provide thought leadership in data space. Partner with local and global leadership to drive analytics and reporting outcomes. Manage the backlog of projects with appropriate prioritisation, consulting with the business to set appropriate expectations. Promote a culture of analytics in APJ across business functions to foster connected thinking, drive business performance and uncover optimization opportunities for the Commercial organization. Create functional and technical documentation related to Business Intelligence solutions. Escalate well defined reports to global analytics team for global rollout. Act as voice of global analytics team within region and vice versa. Test, rollout and educate new analytics functionality with relevant stakeholders. Work with people from a variety of nationalities and cultures across the Asia Pacific commercial team. All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities. Preferred Educational Background: Bachelor??s Degree desired in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, Business or related field. Preferred Experience & Skills: 5 to 8+ years of progressive hands-on experience in business intelligence, reporting, and analytics through continuous, focused experience in the build, customizing and publishing of Tableau interactive reports, visualizations, dashboards and stories Previous experience within a client or customer facing role (e.g. sales, sales operations, customer service or commercial support) is preferred. Experience in supporting Operations and/or Sales functional reporting a plus. Broad-based experience in biotech, medical devices or life sciences highly desirable. Strong experience with Tableau (Tableau Desktop required, Tableau Server a plus). Intermediate knowledge of SQL. Knowledge of SAP HANA, Python and R a plus. Certifications are a plus. Experience in advanced techniques in data modelling, predictive modelling including machine learning a plus. Strong interpersonal skills and proven experience in building successful partnerships with business and technical groups. Outstanding communication skills and ability to convey complex ideas in a simple to understand manner, with demonstrated abilities in data storytelling. Demonstrated ability to understand new datasets and data structures and synthesize data into actionable information.Working proficiency with complex data from multiple data sources and building dashboards. Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories, principles, and practice. Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment. Ability to creatively take on new challenges and work outside their comfort zone. Highly self-motivated to deliver both independently and with strong team collaboration in complex cross-functional teams. Excellent organisation and time management skills. Demonstrated capability to use sound project management methods in managing development backlog. Ability to work under pressure to targets or deadlines. Excellent attention to detail, working to a high level of accuracy. Job Description: About Deutsche Bank Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. We??re driving growth through our strong client franchise. Against a backdrop of increasing globalization in the world economy, Deutsche Bank is very well-positioned, with significant regional diversification and substantial revenue streams from all the major regions of the world. We serve our clients?? real economic needs in commercial banking, investment banking, private banking and asset management. We are investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. All this means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients. The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme An internship at Deutsche Bank is your stepping stone to success and your first look into what life is like on our Graduate Programme. You??ll become part of a collaborative and inclusive workplace as you build on your technical and interpersonal skills, take on real responsibilities, hear from senior leadership through our speaker series, work on live projects, grow your network and learn first-hand how we deliver for our clients. If you want the opportunity to shape your own career as well as the future of the financial industry, then we will give you the platform and foundation to do so. Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme. About Technology, Data and Innovation Technology underpins Deutsche Bank??s entire business and is changing and shaping the way we engage, interact and transact with our stakeholders, internally and externally. Our Technology, Data and Innovation (TDI) strategy is strengthening our engineering expertise, introducing an agile delivery model, and is modernising the bank's IT infrastructure with long-term investments and taking advantage of cloud computing. We are building a team of visionary technology talent that will ensure that we thrive in this period of unprecedented change for the industry. That means hiring the right people and giving them the training, freedom and opportunity they need to do pioneering work. They develop and deliver solutions to help modernise technology solutions, to reduce complexity and risk, and to drive business growth. Through job placements, training courses, seminars, and a variety of networking events you will gain a wide range of practical experience and interpersonal skills with a bank that??s truly driving change in the financial and digital world. By becoming part of our bank, you??ll become part of a diverse and inclusive network that will continue to support you for the rest of your career. Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme in Summer 2022. The area in which you would work is within Information Security. What we look for We seek interns with strong problem solving skills who can collaborate effectively in teams and across locations. This means having outstanding communication, empathy and influencing skills. You should be proactive; challenging established ways of working to instead innovate and improve. You should be focused on delivering in an agile way, which means continually creating value for the business, and learning and continuously improving yourself and your team??s performance. We recruit interns who are inquisitive and want to understand how and why things work, and then improve them, in the process developing their capability. This means being passionate about technology and the business, and constantly making things better for our customers. Our interns are studying for degrees in many disciplines and you won??t necessarily need a formal mathematical or financial background. We have comprehensive training programmes to give you all the technical knowledge you??ll need to contribute straight away. Open to students graduating between August 2021 to July 2022. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. The Team 100x Group's Commercial department is responsible for commercial activities across the group, including those of the BitMEX platform. Excited about cryptocurrency trading and the broader market. Attention to detail and strong views on data structures & policies. Company Overview: Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, a leading provider of credit market data, analytical tools and risk services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide help investors to make important credit judgments with confidence. As a global credit rating agency, Fitch Ratings gauges the ability of entities and instruments to meet their credit obligations. Investors and financial market participants rely on multiple sources, and the credit rating ?? indicating how an issue or transaction is likely to perform over time ?? is one of their key inputs. In this way, we help investors map potential credit risks. Fitch Solutions, a subsidiary of Fitch Ratings, provides a range of industry-leading products and professional development services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, it distributes the ratings, research and financial data of Fitch Ratings through a variety of flexible platforms. With innovation and experience behind every solution it brings to market, our offerings are designed to meet the diverse needs of the fixed-income markets. Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Regional Retail Data Analyst??s role is to maintain a high, accurate and consistent level of visibility into PUDO??s performance across each of our markets. This will be done through writing/maintaining database queries (and presenting such information in a structured and concise manner) and coordinating with operating units to ensure data capture is consistent with realities on ground. The Regional Data Analyst would also be responsible for the efficiency of PUDO data extraction across the region and working with the Business Intelligence department to ensure that our databases are optimally structured to facilitate data analysis. Get to know our Team  The Grab Financials Group Data and Insights team is an established team responsible for growing business by use of data. We make an impact by converting data into information required for data driven decisions making. Our team is made up of data analytics, business analytics and data engineers. If you are looking to make a difference in the lives of millions in SEA with Data and Insights, then you should join our team!  Get to know the Role  We are looking for an Experienced Professional to drive insights and data team. We believe a successful candidate has a solid understanding of Data Driven Insights, but if you believe you have what it takes then we??d love to hear from you either way. Role also involves, helping set up and execute small scale business experiments that provide insights on how the business can find ways of being more effective. This requires working closely with various teams within Grab (Product, Data, Engineering etc.) to understand data requirements, identify and track key metrics, and provide data driven insights that are tailored and relevant to market evolving needs.  Day-to-Day Activities Design, implement and maintain a world-class data reporting and insights framework across GFG. Deliver elegant, exec-ready dashboards and insights. Use advanced visualisation techniques to leverage facts into initiatives to support the business. Get things done across multiple analytics stakeholders within the group to ensure accurate data collection, processing, storage and maintenance. Support business operational reporting needs such as case management insights as well as workforce management and planning processes. Develop reporting, toolkits and dashboards for Grab Financial Groups to optimize campaign performance, across digital and offline channels Understand business requirements and work on objectives in order to conduct in-depth analysis on relevant customer data sets and propose actionable recommendations. The recommendations should provide strategic business insight and support the business in their decision making and planning process. The Must Haves You have the Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility required to work at Grab At Least 2 to 5 years experience in Data Analytics/Business Intelligence Solid experience in reporting to CEO / directors in delivering analyses and reports Extensive expertise in data modeling, both logical and physical Extensive expertise in at least one data reporting tool (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, Looker, Microstrategy) A solid understanding of key BI trends Expertise in data retrieval, data modeling, data warehouse design, and predictive modeling Excellent English language skills, able to communicate effectively, and persuasively across a diverse set of stakeholders Comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and operating in a fast-changing, unstructured environment Payments and FinTech experience (e.g card schemes, PSPs, acquirers, APMs) is a strong advantage

Position Summary: We are looking for a seasoned analytics professional to work in our Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Data & Analytics group, focused on designing and deploying dashboards, ad-hoc reports and other visualization tools to provide business insights for our regional Commercial teams. The ideal candidate will have a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for our commercial operations. This position will work closely with leaders across sales, services, operations and marketing to support and implement high-quality, data-driven decisions. They will use a combination of analytical and visualization techniques and potentially advanced data modeling and predictive modeling techniques where necessary to interpret key findings and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes. They will take requirements for analysis or reporting and ensure optimal data capture, insights attainment, and reporting capabilities are available, escalating regional needs to global teams where necessary. They will be an expert in defining and deploying these key metrics, reports, and dashboards to provide a 360 view of performance across key internal and customer processes, collaborating with global teams to identify knowledge gaps and developing plans to ascertain critical insights to progress our commercial strategy where necessary. This position will report directly to the Associate Director, Data & Analytics - APJ and can be based in Singapore or Australia.  Tasks & Responsibilities: Create interactive stories, dashboards, and visualizations leveraging Tableau. Develop data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support key business decisions. Build the required data extracts required for solutions, extracting from multiple sources where necessary. Analyse data from multiple angles, looking for trends that highlight areas of concerns or opportunities. Capture user requirements for standard reports. Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business need and requirements. Define user requirements and work with users to execute projects to meet requirements. Create and maintain user personas, use-cases, and business requirements documents. Generate ad-hoc reports for field sales, customer care or service managers and assist in the data mining process upon request. Empower end-users to ask their own questions of company/industry data through development and deployment of self-service reporting. Deliver transformative solutions that are aligned to industry best practices and provide thought leadership in data space. Partner with local and global leadership to drive analytics and reporting outcomes. Manage the backlog of projects with appropriate prioritisation, consulting with the business to set appropriate expectations. Promote a culture of analytics in APJ across business functions to foster connected thinking, drive business performance and uncover optimization opportunities for the Commercial organization. Create functional and technical documentation related to Business Intelligence solutions. Escalate well defined reports to global analytics team for global rollout. Act as voice of global analytics team within region and vice versa. Test, rollout and educate new analytics functionality with relevant stakeholders. Work with people from a variety of nationalities and cultures across the Asia Pacific commercial team. All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities. Preferred Educational Background: Bachelor??s Degree desired in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, Business or related field. Preferred Experience & Skills: 5 to 8+ years of progressive hands-on experience in business intelligence, reporting, and analytics through continuous, focused experience in the build, customizing and publishing of Tableau interactive reports, visualizations, dashboards and stories Previous experience within a client or customer facing role (e.g. sales, sales operations, customer service or commercial support) is preferred. Experience in supporting Operations and/or Sales functional reporting a plus. Broad-based experience in biotech, medical devices or life sciences highly desirable. Strong experience with Tableau (Tableau Desktop required, Tableau Server a plus). Intermediate knowledge of SQL. Knowledge of SAP HANA, Python and R a plus. Certifications are a plus. Experience in advanced techniques in data modelling, predictive modelling including machine learning a plus. Strong interpersonal skills and proven experience in building successful partnerships with business and technical groups. Outstanding communication skills and ability to convey complex ideas in a simple to understand manner, with demonstrated abilities in data storytelling. Demonstrated ability to understand new datasets and data structures and synthesize data into actionable information.Working proficiency with complex data from multiple data sources and building dashboards. Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories, principles, and practice. Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment. Ability to creatively take on new challenges and work outside their comfort zone. Highly self-motivated to deliver both independently and with strong team collaboration in complex cross-functional teams. Excellent organisation and time management skills. Demonstrated capability to use sound project management methods in managing development backlog. Ability to work under pressure to targets or deadlines. Excellent attention to detail, working to a high level of accuracy. Job Description: The Company 100x is the result of the phenomenal success of BitMEX, the world's leading cryptocurrency derivatives trading platform, which has pioneered cryptocurrency trading through relentless commitment to change, and continues to set benchmarks for innovation, liquidity, and security today. The Team 100x Group's Commercial department is responsible for commercial activities across the group, including those of the BitMEX platform. The team develops financial products for our clients to trade, sources, grows and manages our client base, and works with our global partners to develop new business opportunities. The Data Analytics role will act as the central interface to the firm's data repositories, providing support for the business decisions made by the Financial Products, Client & Business Development and Marketing functions as well as helping spot trends in the broader market and our own users' behaviour. Efficiency measurement and analysis for API usage agreements. Provide support for ad-hoc data queries made by the rest of the Revenue Department. Requirements 3+ years experience in a data role, preferably in a financial or fintech institution. Experience building and managing Postgres & No SQL data repositories. Would suit an entrepreneurial, self-starter who loves being part of a dynamic, global team.

Job Description: Job Summary: This position is responsible for the preparation and analysis of management reports, consolidated half year/year end results, budgets/ re-estimates and business case working. This role will also seek to add value to all current processes, as well as provide insight into the company??s business and current operations. This is a 1 year fixed term contract position (renewable). Key Responsibilities and Job-Related Characteristics: Timely preparation of monthly management reports, yearly budget and strategic plan and periodic re-estimates. Business and management analysis with accompanying recommendations. Preparation of monthly journals, PRISMA volume and financial reporting. Business case working and Transfer pricing working as per guidelines Support half yearly consolidation package and accompanying schedules as well as prepare/review inventory reports and other submissions as required. Support external year-end audit. Undertakes ad-hoc analysis to support key initiatives. Undertake new responsibilities as part of role content rotation and ongoing productivity enhancement projects. Knowledge and Skills Requirements: Highly motivated, result-oriented, proactive. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work under pressure. Functional Capabilities Requirements: Ability to review and interpret management reports, demonstrates analytical capabilities in analyzing financial performance including brand & customer profitability and budgetary control. The Sr. Finance Analyst/Controller role is an integral member of the finance community, providing impact as a business partner to demonstrate insight through financial analysis techniques, tools and concepts and to provide practical counsel to drive business results. Who is Hilti? If you??re new to our industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and first-rate service. With 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, we??re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career. What does the role involve? As Controller, you will be the champion of the P&L in your market and bring transparency on the value creation of various functions. You will collaborate with various senior stakeholders across the entire business, including the organization??s Executive Management Team (EMT), regional team and organization??s leadership team. You will drive standardization, automation and process improvement through the organization and contribute to local and global projects to support Finance or the market??s long-term strategy implementation. Together with your manager you drive the performance management process covering the rolling forecasting and strategic investment processes. From an operational perspective, you will own the controlling part of the month end closing activities, such as provide key reports to the management, calculate and maintain variable compensation models and accruals, and provide support to the business on related queries. You will also support your local team and/or a Shared Service Centre with the annual audit and production of financial statements as required. You will fully understand Hilti??s business model and its financial impacts to support the management in decision making to drive results. With an entrepreneurial mindset, you will challenge the status quo, taking calculated risks to drive and develop innovation from within. You will proactively monitor the external environment and translate relevant trends into the organization, to ensure agility and value creation. 93% of our people say they??re proud to work for Hilti, thanks to the quality of our products and the way we look after our people What do we offer? We??ll give you what you need to excel in your role, including ongoing training from the start. Your responsibilities will be great and, with them, we'll give you the freedom and autonomy to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Show us what you??re made of and we??ll offer you opportunities to move around the business ?? to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It??s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you??re after. On top of these, we have a thorough people review process, unlike any we know of in any other business. We screen everyone in the company in a yearly career performance matching process. It means we can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places. It??s how we find the right fit and further our teams personally and professionally. Why should you apply? Year upon year we are recognized as one of the top 'Great Place to Work' employers, both globally and locally. And when you meet us you'll understand why. We have a diverse team of people with a variety of nationalities, backgrounds and experiences. You can gain further insight on how it feels to be part of Hilti??s Global Finance Community, by searching for our LinkedIn feed: #HiltiFinance What you need is: Degree in Business, Finance, or Related Field and either professional accounting qualifications or Masters minimum 6 years?? experience in a financial, consultancy or auditing role within a multinational organization Demonstrated knowledge in Accounting, Controlling, Reporting or Financial Advisory To contribute strong controlling and reporting processes to standardize performance measurement initiatives Demonstrated commitment to business improvement and be able to drive change to achieve results The ability to simplify a financial message to non-finance stakeholders Effective communication skills, including ability to structure clear presentations Strong business planning, financial planning (forecasting/budgeting) and analysis skills Experience in financial planning, modelling and analysis and reporting software preferred (e.g. Excel, Access, Tagetik, SAP Analytics, SQL, Tableau) Proficient English written and verbal communication To be geographically flexible, and have the ambition to pursue an international career By submitting your resume, you confirm and agree that Hilti Asia Pacific Pte Lt and its related companies worldwide (collectively, ??Hilti Group?) may collect, use and disclose your data for their recruitment purposes. This may include selecting, evaluating and recruiting candidates for roles or positions that differ from the above job description, but for which we believe that you may be interested in or appropriate for. We look forward to receiving your application and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. ??There??s a real family spirit and you can literally knock on any director??s door at any time. Also your line manager will work very hard to help you develop your skills, both professionally and personally.? Amer, Key Projects Manager

Job Title: Associate Data Analyst, Global Partnerships Sales Engine
Job Description: Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 2 years of work experience with Account Management, Ad Operations or Project Management  Preferred qualifications: Experience with streamlining operational process (e.g. automation) and familiarity with SQL Advanced knowledge of presentation, spreadsheet, and documentation tools Broad understanding of online advertising (ad serving, monetization solutions) and key platforms and trends (desktop, mobile, video) Ability to be self-motivated and proactive. Comfortable operating in a rapidly changing industry, and the ability to work well with a team Demonstrated analytical, operational efficiency, and stakeholder management ability About the job In this role, you will be part of a team that supports the world??s leading publishers and helps drive accelerated business growth for them through our publisher and platform solutions. The Global Partnerships Sales Engine (GPSE) team is a critical part of driving operational efficiency and scale in support of our publisher and platform solutions. The GPSE team centralizes work away from sales teams so that leaders can concentrate their efforts on customer-specific activities and continue growing a global business. As a data analyst on the GPSE team, you will have the opportunity to work with an extensive range of cross-functional teams on the Global Partnerships side of the business, to further evolve and scale GPSE support. Google??s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users?? needs, advance our partners?? goals, and further Google??s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions ?? from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners. Responsibilities Support users in areas of optimization and troubleshooting. Maintain high service levels through meeting or exceeding customer satisfaction, timeliness and efficiency goals. Support implementation and optimization for Google??s Programmatic and Platform solutions. Provide consultation and support to a vendor team of agents globally. Contribute proactively to the analysis and optimization of processes, internal tools and product to drive efficiency and scale. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Sephora, a division of LVMH - Mo??t Hennessy Louis Vuitton global luxury leader, is a global leader in beauty retailing. It successfully operates more than three thousand points of sale across Americas, Europe, Middle East, and Asia. Its aim is to animate the most loved beauty community in the world.  Sephora South East Asia is a high growth division of leading global beauty retailer, Sephora. Our teams run omnichannel retail businesses in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia, New Zealand, and Hong Kong; Franchise operations in India & Indonesia; and ecommerce-only business (the first in the world globally for Sephora!) in the Philippines. We have recently opened new markets in Hong Kong and New Zealand as well!  Our success is built on innovation, a unique product portfolio, market-leading digital capabilities, and our exceptional people! With ambitious growth plans, we are always looking for talented people who are passionate about building businesses and developing themselves and our customers' experience. Sephora Southeast Asia is seeking to hire an Analyst, Marketing channels in Channels & Martech team. We??re a data-driven omni-channel business operating across 9 different markets in Southeast Asia with a special focus in ecommerce (our platform is built in-house!).  About team: We are responsible for paid marketing channels like Google/Facebook/Networks & Owned marketing channels like seo, emails, sms, mobile app. It??s a data driven team with focus on achieving key business objectives and has a constant need to drive innovation. We were the one of the firsts to build deterministic omni-channel attribution in SEA. We are looking for an analytical and systematic thinker, who is naturally curious about customer behaviour across marketing channels and passionate about using data to improve performance.  You will have an opportunity to get an in-depth understanding of different marketing channels, Martech stack, Analytics platform & to work on business intelligence tools..  Key Roles & Responsibilities Analyze data, reports and trends across marketing channels to understand the best approach to optimize ROAS & Marketing efficiency. Develop and continually iterate A/B testing framework for marketing channels Working closely with the Marketing channels & Marketing Tech team and sharing data insights to be used for improving campaign efficiency. Building & Maintaining tracker on business intelligence tool (DOMO) for marketing channels. Develop forecasts & strategies to optimize monthly & annual paid marketing spends. Analyzing marketing channels & campaigns to reduce the overlap & optimize the marketing efforts Working closely with the mobile team to build models around - segments & Audiences. Analyse campaigns, mechanics, its commercial impact and share insights & propose strategies to the local markets Making hypotheses and recommendations to improve overall marketing effectiveness.  Key-skills required. Strong Problem-solving ability & analytical skills. Experience using SQL to query is mandatory. Previous experience in understanding marketing channels like Google Adwords, Facebook & Analytics & attribution platforms like Google Analytics, Appsflyer, Adobe Analytics is a plus. Quick learner & strong inclination towards understanding Business & different marketing channels Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. Fundamentally curious, Always tinkering and exploring new tech Should be data driven. When joining Sephora, you join the fastest growing and most innovative omnichannel retailer in South East Asia. As part of LVMH, (www.lvmh.com/group), we provide an unparalleled combination of resources, scale, and autonomy to our employees.  Sephora SEA was created through the combination of the Sephora's retail business in South East Asia and Luxola, a Singaporean start-up that broke new frontiers in ecommerce regionally. We proudly maintain an entrepreneurial and technology-focused culture, with all our capabilities built in-house ?? a rarity in this region.  The data is definitive: diversity leads to better teams, better performance, and better results. Consequently, we actively seek to hire employees of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences. We provide our employees with a unique opportunity to take on senior responsibilities, accelerate their career path, and impact the business of beauty across the world.

Job Description: FGE's Singapore office is expanding its operations. As such, we are looking to recruit an NGLs (Natural Gas Liquids) Analyst to join our team of NGLs experts.  We are a team of experienced professionals with a wide range of international clients, mainly oil companies, financial institutions and producer governments. Consultancy services include the provision of regular research, interacting with clients and undertaking special studies and reports. The entrepreneurial spirit of FGE??s consultants allows for a dynamic working environment that enables the company to adapt and develop its products in line with changes within the industry. This dynamism also allows the company to provide unrivalled organic growth opportunities to candidates with a proven ability to develop and expand the business.  Analysing NGLs as part of the global team, the successful candidate will enhance their already strong numeric and analytical skills and eventually becoming a regional or subject expert. Working alongside the NGLs team, upstream, refining and economic specialists, the successful candidate will have exposure to the complete NGL market cycle giving the successful driven and motivated candidate an accelerated learning curve and unparalleled exposure to the industry.  The Role and Responsibilities: Collecting data and information with regards to market fundamentals and pricing for Natural Gas Liquids.  Supply and demand forecasting for propane and butane.  Analysing macro and micro economic oil, gas, NGLs & LNG data.  Working as part of the NGLs team to generate price forecasts taking into account market fundamentals and forward pricing.  Analysing and modelling industry trends building forecasts, databases, and evaluations for FGE??s short-term and long-term NGLs services.  Report writing and contributing to FGE??s regular NGLs services (LPG & Condensate/Naphtha) via original research.  Coordinating and engaging in project and retainer work.  Providing research assistance to consultants and contributing towards client proposals and ad-hoc projects.  Preparing both internal and external client presentation material and answering client queries.  Applicant Requirements: The ideal applicant will be a highly numerate graduate with oil industry experience; alternatively, from a finance, engineering, economics or similar background, and will possess the following attributes:  Bachelor??s Degree in engineering, economics, business administration or similar discipline.  1-2 years?? experience of the oil industry/analysis experience. Ability to undertake independent research and work with a project team.  Good writing and oral presentation skills.  Fluent (written and verbal) in English.  Fluency in Mandarin (written and verbal) is beneficial.  Proficient in Microsoft Excel ideally to macro level.  Ability to perform in a deadline driven environment and deliver work in a timely manner.  Able to travel.  Ability to work effectively with regional offices to promote products globally.  Able to support business development activities.  Able to learn and development new skills.

Job Description: Details of the Division and Team: The Market Data Services (MDS) team is responsible for the end-to-end provisioning and deactivation of market data across Deutsche Bank. This includes the data and financial management of market data products used by Deutsche Bank employees (e.g. Bloomberg, Refinitiv, FactSet). This data allows traders and Business users across the Bank to know the latest price and see historical trends for instruments such as equities, fixed-income products, derivatives and currencies. The MDS team globally supports ~12,000 users across 43 countries. MDS are working to implement a cohesive and efficient market data strategy for Deutsche Bank. The aim is to execute that strategy across the Bank with the clear objective of reducing market data costs. This will require working closely in conjunction with external vendors and all internal functions including global sourcing and infrastructure. Central point of contact for market data advice regarding data access requirements Regular interaction with Business Managers to review market data cost reduction initiatives Management and approval of market data requests across applications and desktops Manage and coordinate vendor activity such trials, demos and training Evaluate potential new solutions/products and implement to reduce costs Review existing market data access across divisions to establish the current data usage requirements across applications and desktops Regular reporting on cost reduction and product displacement programs Distribute analysis and reporting of usage to establish key requirements and metrics to support and assist contract negotiations Relationship management of strategic vendors including Exchanges and Brokers Relationship management of Divisional senior management Manage market data audits globally Manage vendor data notifications of future changes impacting data policies and pricing Manage risk and compliance of applications consuming market data and annual recertification of applications Vendor Risk Management activities to meet internal and regulatory standards for vendor engagements Your skills and experience : Previous Market Data knowledge ideally within large financial institution or investment bank; We are looking for a dynamic, self-motivated and enthusiastic individual to join our team as Market Analyst.  You will provide energy markets research, analysis and reporting related to crude oil, petroleum products and chemicals.  You will be responsible for analysing pricing, demand-supply balances, the underlying reasons for factors affecting demand and supply variables and prepare decision-support reports, illustrate data graphically that help Management make informed decisions on prices. You are also responsible for analysing industry performance, competitive analysis, end-use sectoral analysis, analysing grade portfolios and demand supply scenarios to proactively suggest opportunities and highlight threats to the business.  Job description Provide support for pricing and operational decisions and market reporting by gathering updates on latest market prices, spreads, margins, industry trends, etc. Locate, gather, organise and analyse global energy data from multiple sources to perform demand/ supply forecasting and market analysis based on end-application sectors for target geographies. Develop Asian supply and demand balance models. Provide views on forward product cracks and refining margins. Develop arbitrage and cargo economic models. Monitor futures / forward market structure. Perform ship tracking. Identify opportunities and threats to the business. Qualifications / Experience Bachelor??s degree in Engineering, Finance, Economics or a related discipline. Minimum 3 years?? experience in a marketing or business analyst role supporting oil trading or petrochemicals sales and marketing operation to provide analysis, reporting support and to improve business performance. Familiarity with Asian refinery configurations and product yields. Exposure to Refinery LP/ optimisation programs is a plus. Excellent analytical skills to collect, collate and evaluate large amount of data. Strong proficiency in MS Excel to analyze data effectively. Quantitative skills (Excel Marcos) is a plus. Strong proficiency in MS Powerpoint to present insights effectively. Ability to conduct cost-benefit analysis and develop business case. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing skills. Understanding of the petrochemical market, products applications and pricing methodologies & practices Ability to combine industry knowledge with analysis of internal and external data to present actionable insights, opportunities and threats for the business to address  How to apply If you believe you meet the requirements for this role, please contact us with your CV stating your experience as well as current & expected salary.

Working in cybersecurity takes passion for technology, speed, a desire to learn, and vigilance in order to keep every asset safe. You'll be on the front lines of innovation, working with a highly motivated team focused on analyzing, designing, developing and delivering solutions built to stop adversaries and strengthen our operations. Your research and work will ensure stability, capacity, and resiliency of our products. Working with your internal team, as well as technologists and innovators across our global network, your ability to identify threats, provide intelligent analysis, and positive actions will stop crimes and strengthen our data. Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Triage Analysts perform many functions in support of data security at the firm. They review prioritized alerts generated by monitoring systems, perform an initial investigation and determine if the associated activity requires further investigation by Global Security, assist in technology and process improvement efforts, work with the content development team to refine detection and prioritization capabilities, analyze trends and patterns in DLP activity and work with stakeholders to reduce the risk of data loss across all lines of business. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Investigative mindset and the ability to follow data and build a case Foundational knowledge of cybersecurity organization practices, operations, risk management processes, principles, architectural requirements, engineering and threats and vulnerabilities, including incident response methodologies Knowledge of Data Loss Prevention (DLP), potentially including experience developing risk-aligned DLP monitoring rules, knowledge of DLP systems and products or experience on a security assurance operations team peforming DLP triage operations functions Knowledge and experience related to Insider Threat monitoring and operations is a plus Ability to collaborate with high-performing Agile teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish goals Proficiency in the use of tools, staying current with skills, participating in multiple forums related to cybersecurity, Data Loss Prevention or Insider Threat Ability to analyze vulnerabilities, threats, designs, procedures and architectural design, producing reports and sharing intelligence Experience reviewing logs, developing Splunk queries and dashboards, automating manual tasks is a plus Foundational knowledge of: computer forensics; legal, government and jurisprudence as they relate to cybersecurity; operating systems; and methods for intelligence gathering and sharing is preferable Foundational knowledge of: cloud computing, computer network defense, external organizations and academic institutions dealing with cybersecurity issues, financial authorities and regulations, identity management, incident management, information assurance, information management, information systems and network security and infrastructure design is preferable  The candidate will also need to learn to use of one or more High Security Access (HSA) systems. Users of these systems are subject to enhanced screening, which includes both criminal and credit background checks, and/or other enhanced screening at the time of accepting the position and on an annual basis thereafter. The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.J.P. Position Description: ROLE Account Analyst within the Global Wealth Management team focused on supporting the client servicing, business development and relationship management effort with wealth management clients. This trend is being driven by a variety of factors - changing client demands, an emphasis on excellence and selecting best of breed managers and cost controls. Against this background, the Global Wealth Management channel has been identified as a key source of business growth for PIMCO in Asia. PIMCO sees a clear opportunity to continue building its wealth management franchise with Singapore financial institutions. Consequently, PIMCO would like to recruit an Account Analyst to provide on the desk support to the Account Management team focused on client servicing, business development and relationship management amongst its wealth management clients. The position is viewed as an important component of the support network required to maintain and continue building out PIMCO??s franchise within the space. PIMCO is a member of the Allianz Group of companies, a European based multi-national insurance and financial services holding company. PIMCO??s culture is entrepreneurial with a flat hierarchy and a high performance environment. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES This position requires an energetic, analytical and detailed orientated professional who can:  Accurately and efficiently prepare client reports and respond to client queries on portfolio performance, risk metrics, marketing material requests and the planning of events / road shows. Support the Account Management team through the provision of market, product and portfolio data. Effectively utilize tools such as Excel spreadsheets, macros, and query tools, along with internet sites, both public and private. Knowledge of Bloomberg and/or other index providers such as Barclays and Morgan Markets are a plus. Analyze and explain portfolio data including qualitative and quantitative performance attribution. Communicate effectively with clients and colleagues demonstrating a ??goes the extra mile?? attitude in internal and external interactions. Frequently shifts priorities demonstrating the ability to efficiently manage their time. Focus on specific goals, and demonstrate a sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results. Foster a sense of teamwork by assisting others when needed/required. Makes a strong commitment to PIMCO??s culture, values and approach.  Position Requirements: IDEAL EXPERIENCE Up to two years of finance-related experience, preferably from within the investment or wealth management industry. Collegiate team player, experienced and comfortable in an international operating environment. Can demonstrate an understanding of economics, capital markets and investment concepts. Fresh graduates with strong academic background are welcome to apply.  EDUCATION/CERTICIATIONS Bachelor degree. Progress towards regulatory certificate in relevant jurisdiction. Prepared to make progress towards attaining the CFA designation.
